text: Michigan Central Railroad Engine Repair Shops, also known as the Tonn and Blank Building , was a historic railroad engine repair building located at Michigan City, LaPorte County, Indiana. It was built in 1851-1852 by the Michigan Central Railroad. It was constructed of Joliet limestone and measured 255 feet long and 62 feet wide. Note: This includes It has been demolished. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1975 and delisted in 1978. ==References== Category:Former National Register of Historic Places in Indiana Michigan city Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1852 Category:Transportation buildings and structures in LaPorte County, Indiana Category:National Register of Historic Places in LaPorte County, Indiana Category:1852 establishments in Indiana
title: Michigan Central Railroad Engine Repair Shops
